alert.note: Alert for Navarro (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 9:03AM CDT until October 26 at 11:17PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Henderson and Navarro counties in North Texas. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corsicana, Gun Barrel City, Mabank, Malakoff, Tool, Kerens, Seven Points, Trinidad, Blooming Grove, Dawson, Angus, Enchanted Oaks, Barry, Caney City, Navarro, Lake Halbert, Richland-Chambers Reservoir, Flag Lake, Trinidad Lake and Navarro Mills Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
